strategy_reasoning: Using a cozy 'Dev Log' retro game aesthetic makes technical updates (security tokens, OOM errors, URL encoding) feel approachable and nostalgic rather than dry and corporate. The 8-bit style aligns with the 'indie dev/builder' audience while the lime green and pastel palette keeps it on-brand and emotionally warm.

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art title screen. Large blocky 8-bit text 'DEV LOG'. A tiny pixel bee character üêù holding a small wrench. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and lavender gradient background. Chunky retro sprites. Warm lighting, lo-fi vibes like Stardew Valley. Nostalgic but beautiful title card.
images.description: Cover slide introducing the updates as a retro game 'Dev Log'

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art workspace scene. A retro CRT monitor on a wooden desk showing a perfectly clear, beautiful pixel flower üå∏ (representing fixed image generation). A tiny 8-bit bee looks happy. Soft pastel room, warm lamp light, lime green accents. Unpacking game vibe. No glitches, just clean pixels.
images.description: Visualizing the I2I fix - clear images on a retro screen

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art security concept. A shiny golden pixel key üóùÔ∏è floating near a locked honeycomb safe. Soft purple and lime green (#ecf874) gradient background. Magical sparkles, chunky pixels. Secure and calm atmosphere. A Short Hike aesthetic. Symbolizing token rotation.

Cozy pixel art status screen. A large friendly pixel robot (representing the large model) giving a thumbs up. A retro UI health bar labeled 'VRAM' is stable and green. Soft pastel background. No smoke, no fire, just chill vibes. 8-bit aesthetic, chunky pixels.
images.description: Visualizing the OOM fix - stable memory usage

caption:

alt_text: A carousel of cozy 8-bit pixel art images. 1. A title screen saying DEV LOG with a pixel bee. 2. A retro computer showing a clear flower image. 3. A golden pixel key and safe. 4. A friendly pixel robot with a green stable health bar. All in soft pastels and lime green.
